posts.title: A Symphony in Code
posts.text: Who Am IHey, I’m Bibit Kunwar Chhetri. I’m someone who genuinely enjoys learning — not just the easy stuff, but the kind of learning that takes time, effort, failure, and patience. I’ve always felt that going the hard way teaches me things that shortcuts never could. That’s the path I’ve chosen — one where growth comes from struggle, and clarity from chaos. Software engineering didn’t just give me a career path — it gave me a different way of thinking. A way to break problems into pieces, to see structure where there was once noise, and to constantly seek better answers — in code and in life. About This SiteThis website is where I’ll slowly open up about the things I go through — the new technologies I explore, the hurdles I face, the thoughts that stick with me, and the people I meet along the way. I want this space to feel real, not polished or performative. Some posts might be technical, some reflective, some might just be me trying to figure something out. I don’t have all the answers. I probably never will. But I’m here to share what I know, what I’m learning, what I’m feeling — all in my own time and in my own words. Why I’m HereI’ve always admired how open source works — people coming together to build, to fix, to learn. I hope to contribute to that spirit, not just with code but with honesty. Whatever I go through — whether it’s confusion, excitement, burnout, or breakthrough — I’ll try to share it here. Because that’s how we connect. That’s how we grow. This is just the beginning. I don’t know exactly where I’ll end up, what kind of engineer I’ll become, or what kind of people I’ll meet — but I’m here for it. And I’ll take you along, one post at a time.
